title: Rural Municipality of Grayson No. 184
text:
The Rural Municipality of Grayson No. 184 (<a href="Canada%202016%20Census">2016 population</a>: ) is a <a href="List%20of%20rural%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan">rural municipality</a> (RM) in the <a href="Provinces%20and%20territories%20of%20Canada">Canadian province</a> of <a href="Saskatchewan">Saskatchewan</a> within <a href="Division%20No.%205%2C%20Saskatchewan">Census Division No. 5</a> and <a href="SARM%20Division%20No.%201">Division No. 1</a>.
History.
The RM of Grayson No. 184 incorporated as a rural municipality on January 1, 1913.
Geography.
Communities and localities.
The following <a href="List%20of%20municipalities%20in%20Saskatchewan%23Urban%20municipalities">urban municipalities</a> are surrounded by the RM.
The following unincorporated communities are within the RM.
Demographics.
In the <a href="2016%20Canadian%20Census">2016 Census of Population</a> conducted by <a href="Statistics%20Canada">Statistics Canada</a>, the RM of Grayson No. 184 recorded a population of living in of its total private dwellings, a change from its 2011 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2016.
In the <a href="2011%20Canadian%20Census">2011 Census of Population</a>, the RM of Grayson No. 184 recorded a population of , a change from its 2006 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2011.
Government.
The RM of Grayson No. 184 is governed by an elected municipal council and an appointed administrator that meets on the second Wednesday of every month. The <a href="Reeve%20%28Canada%29">reeve</a> of the RM is Harvey Mucha while its administrator is Sarah Dietrich. The RM's office is located in Grayson.
